channel.title: Coding Teacher Podcast
channel.description: A podcast about teaching how to code, for friends of the Codeweek.EU project and for anyone interested in teaching and coding.
channel.itunes:author: Horst JENS and others
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about teaching how to code, for friends of the Codeweek.EU project and for anyone interested in teaching and coding.
channel.itunes:summary: A loose serie of interviews with coding teachers and activists.

item.title: Episode 005: Simon Heppner (age 10) talks about his first python workshop as a teacher
item.description: Simon Heppner, age 10, tells in this Interview with Horst JENS about his first Python Coding workshop that he gave to his classmates.. See https://codingteacherpodcast.github.io for all episodes of the CodingTeacherPodcast
item.content:encoded: Simon Heppner, age 10, tells in this Interview with Horst JENS about his first Python Coding workshop that he gave to his classmates.
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Coding, teacher, CodingTeacherPodcast, Python, teaching, school, Vienna, Austria, student-teaching-students, children, Simon Heppner, spielend-programmieren

item.title: Episode 004: Bhargav Srinivasea Desikan about Google Summer of Code
item.description: Bhargav Srinivasea Desikan talks in this interview at the PyConSK conference 2017 about his own experience with Google Summer of Code. He explains how he come first into contact with open Source projects and how the Google Summer of code program changed his life. See https://codingteacherpodcast.github.io for all episodes of the CodingTeacherPodcast
item.content:encoded: Bhargav Srinivasea Desikan talks in this interview at the PyConSK conference 2017 about his own experience with Google Summer of Code. He explains how he come first into contact with open Source projects and how the Google Summer of code program changed his life.
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Coding, teacher, CodingTeacherPodcast, Google, Summer of Code, gsoc, learning, open source, floss, foss, job, student, recruiting, volunteering, Bhargav Srinivasea Desikan

item.title: Episode 003: Valdemar Švábenskỳ about teaching python to freshmen students
item.description: Valdemar Švábenskỳ talks in this interview at the PyConSK conference 2017 about teaching Python to freshman students, of differences in cooperation between female and male students and he explains how to become elected as "teacher of the year". See https://codingteacherpodcast.github.io for all episodes of the CodingTeacherPodcast
item.content:encoded: Valdemar Švábenskỳ talks in this interview at the PyConSK conference 2017 about teaching Python to freshman students, of differences in cooperation between female and male students and he explains how to become elected as "teacher of the year".
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Coding, teacher, CodingTeacherPodcast, Python, teaching, university, Bratislava, Slovakia, peer-programming, gender, Valdemar Švábenskỳ

item.title: Episode 002: Joek van Montfort speaks Scratch conference in Boston 2016
item.description: Joek van Montfort speaks with Horst JENS about the Scratch conference 2016 in Boston, USA. See https://codingteacherpodcast.github.io for all episodes of the CodingTeacherPodcast
item.content:encoded: Joek van Montfort speaks with Horst JENS about the Scratch conference 2016 in Boston, USA.
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Coding, teacher, CodingTeacherPodcast, Scratch, conference, Boston, USA, visual-coding, Joek_van_Montfort

item.title: Episode 001: Joek van Montfort speaks about Mozfest, the Mozilla conference in London
item.description: Joek van Montfort speaks with Horst JENS about the Mozfest Mozilla programming conference in London. See https://codingteacherpodcast.github.io for all episodes of the CodingTeacherPodcast
item.content:encoded: Joek van Montfort speaks with Horst JENS about the Mozfest Mozilla programming conference in London.
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Coding, teacher, CodingTeacherPodcast, Mozfest, conference, festival, open Internet, London, mozilla, web-programming, Joek_van_Montfort
